sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A famouse cronicle of oure time, called Sleidanes Commentaries concerning the state of religion and common wealth, during the raigne of the Emperour Charles the fift, with the argumentes set before euery booke, conteyninge the summe or effecte of the booke following. Translated out of Latin into Englishe, by Ihon Daus. Here vnto is added also an apology of the authoure. De statu religionis et reipublicae, Carolo Quinto Caesare, commentarii. English Sleidanus, Johannes, 1506-1556. Daus, John.
[6], ccccxliiii, ccccxlix-cccclxx, [18] leaves
By Ihon Daie, for Nicholas Englande, [Imprinted at London : M.D.LX. [1560] The .26. daie of September]
A translation of: De statu religionis et reipublicae, Carolo Quinto Caesare, comentarii. Imprint from colophon. Includes index. The last leaf is blank. A later state of the edition dated 25 Sept. 1560, with cancel leaves 3Q2.3. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
=======
A famouse cronicle of oure time, called Sleidanes Commentaries concerning the state of religion and common wealth, during the raigne of the Emperour Charles the fift, with the argumentes set before euery booke, conteyninge the summe or effecte of the booke following. Translated out of Latin into Englishe, by Ihon Daus. Here vnto is added also an apology of the authoure. De statu religionis et reipublicae, Carolo Quinto Caesare, commentarii. English Sleidanus, Johannes, 1506-1556. Daus, John.
[6], ccccxliiii, ccccxlix-cccclxx, [18] leaves
By Ihon Daie, for Nicholas Englande, [Imprinted at London : M.D.LX. [1560] The .26. daie of September]
A translation of: De statu religionis et reipublicae, Carolo Quinto Caesare, comentarii. Imprint from colophon. Includes index. The last leaf is blank. A later state of the edition dated 25 Sept. 1560, with cancel leaves 3Q2.3. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
Nicholas Englande
Ihon Daie
